macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Slips Below 50,000 Amid Record Bullishness and Low Cash Levels
items.summary: The Dow Jones has slipped below 50,000 following a BofA survey indicating record bullishness but low cash reserves, signaling potential range-bound trading. Traders await more direction after a long weekend.

items.title: US Stock Markets Directionless with Tight Ranges Across Major Indices
items.summary: Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq are holding within tight ranges for multiple sessions, with Nasdaq showing resilience at key support levels forming a double bottom. Path of least resistance points to retests of higher pivots unless support breaks.

items.title: Wall Street Mood Shifts as Investors Pull Back from Tech and Banks
items.summary: S&P 500 closed down 1.4% with technology and banks dropping 2.0% and 6.7% respectively, while utilities and materials rallied sharply amid intensifying sector rotations.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Market Consolidates with Declines in Bitcoin, Ethereum, and XRP
items.summary: Bitcoin trades at $68,362 down 0.74%, Ethereum at $1,981 down 0.85%, and XRP at $1.49 down 1% amid February consolidation and bearish signals. The market remains 50% below all-time highs with analysts noting 'genuine distress' and awaiting U.S. Supreme Court tariff ruling on February 20.

items.title: Bitcoin Bears Maintain Technical Advantage in Early Trading
items.summary: February bitcoin futures weaken in early U.S. trading on February 17, with bears holding the near-term technical edge according to veteran analyst Jim Wyckoff.

items.title: Bitcoin's Sharp Decline from $100K Highs Tests Key Support Levels
items.summary: Bitcoin has fallen from January highs near $100,000 to around $60,000 by early February 2026, intensified by deleveraging, macroeconomic pressures, and growing risk-off sentiment.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Minimax Launches M2.5 AI Model With State-of-the-Art Productivity and Performance
items.summary: Minimax introduced MiniMax-M2.5, trained with reinforcement learning across hundreds of thousands of complex environments. The model achieves 80.2% on SWE-Bench Verified for coding tasks, 51.3% on Multi-SWE-Bench, and 76.3% on BrowseComp, with ultra-low operating costs.

items.title: Zhipu AI Launches GLM-5 for Complex Systems Engineering and Agentic Tasks
items.summary: GLM-5 scales from 355B parameters (32B active) to 744B parameters (40B active) with pre-training data increased from 23T to 28.5T tokens. The model integrates DeepSeek Sparse Attention to reduce deployment costs while preserving long-context capacity.

items.title: Google DeepMind Unveils Gemini Deep Think for Research Acceleration
items.summary: Gemini Deep Think, developed under direction from expert mathematicians and scientists, is solving professional research problems across mathematics, physics, and computer science.

items.title: Ericsson Launches AI-Ready Radios and RAN Software for Next-Generation Networks
items.summary: Ericsson introduced AI-ready radios with neural network accelerators, AI-powered RAN software with beamforming and positioning capabilities, and tools delivering up to seven times faster response times for AI and AR applications.

items.title: AI in Regulatory Affairs Market Reaches $1.9 Billion With 18.65% CAGR Growth Projected
items.summary: The global AI in regulatory affairs market is expanding rapidly with breakthroughs in automated document generation, compliance monitoring, and AI-enabled regulatory intelligence. Key February 2026 developments include Global Key Solutions' KeyPedia platform and EDETEK's Ensemble AI Managed Services.

items.title: AI Moves Into Production Phase for Insurance Industry in 2026
items.summary: After years of experimentation, AI systems in insurance are transitioning from pilots to live production, with increased adoption of voice-based interfaces and expansion into front-office customer-facing applications including sales, servicing, and engagement.

items.title: Stanford Researchers Use Satellite Imagery and AI to Map Global Development Needs
items.summary: A new study published in Nature Communications used satellite imagery and machine learning to estimate Human Development Index scores for 61,530 municipalities worldwide, revealing development needs hidden by national-level data.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Hasbro Shuts Down Internal Video Game Studio Atomic Arcade
items.summary: Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast have shuttered their internal video game studio Atomic Arcade, as indicated by LinkedIn posts from staff. This closure adds to ongoing layoffs and studio shutdowns in the industry.

items.title: Zillow Launches Zillow for Warcraft to Explore World of Warcraft Homes
items.summary: Real estate platform Zillow has introduced Zillow for Warcraft, a new feature allowing users to explore homes from the World of Warcraft universe. The tool blends gaming and real estate in an innovative crossover.

items.title: ALTKEY Games Announces Retail Roguelite 'Welcome to Your Retail Roguelite Nightmare'
items.summary: Canadian indie studio ALTKEY Games revealed their upcoming unhinged, action-packed roguelite game set in a retail nightmare environment. The announcement highlights bold, chaotic gameplay mechanics.

items.title: Matthew Ball Releases 2026 State of Gaming Report with 164 Slides
items.summary: Industry analyst Matthew Ball published a comprehensive 164-slide report on the state of gaming in 2026, analyzing competition for attention against other entertainment and citing extensive research.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: SpaceX Competes in Pentagon's $100M Contest for Autonomous Drone Swarming Tech
items.summary: SpaceX and its subsidiary xAI are participating in a secret Pentagon challenge to develop voice-controlled autonomous drone swarming technology, as reported by Bloomberg. The six-month competition, initiated in January, selects a few companies for the prize amid U.S. efforts to accelerate drone development.
